Frame Child Carriers</title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2015/CPSC-Approves-New-Federal-Safety-Standard-for-Frame-Child-Carriers/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2015/CPSC-Approves-New-Federal-Safety-Standard-for-Frame-Child-Carriers/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</guid>       <description>The new federal standard incorporates by reference, with no modifications, ASTM F2549-14a, Standard Consumer Safety Specification for Frame Child Carriers, and becomes effective 18 months after the standard is published in the Federal Register.</description>       <pubDate>Tue, 24 Feb 2015 16:00:00 GMT</pubDate>       <media:group xmlns:media="media">         <media:content url="/Global/Images/News%20Releases/2015/15085/Backpack-carrier-Thumbnail.jpg" width="87" height="63" />       </media:group>     </item>     <item>       <title>General Electric Agrees to $3.5 Pilot Risk Assessment Tool to Strengthen Import Safety Program</title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/CPSC-Uses-Pilot-Risk-Assessment-Tool-to-Strengthen-Import-Safety/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/CPSC-Uses-Pilot-Risk-Assessment-Tool-to-Strengthen-Import-Safety/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</guid>       <description>State-of-the-art risk assessment methodology allowed CPSC to protect consumers from 6.1 million units of products that violated U.S. safety rules or that were found to be defective in the first and second quarters of fiscal year 2013.</description>       <pubDate>Mon, 02 Dec 2013 15:00:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Global System of Toy Safety Works to Keep Kids Safe This Holiday Season; Recalls Down, Port Seizures Up </title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/Global-System-of-Toy-Safety-Works-to-Keep-Kids-Safe-This-Holiday-Season-Recalls-Down-Port-Seizures-Up-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/Global-System-of-Toy-Safety-Works-to-Keep-Kids-Safe-This-Holiday-Season-Recalls-Down-Port-Seizures-Up-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</guid>       <description>In fiscal year 2013, CPSC issued only 31 toy recalls, none of which involved a lead violation. The majority of these toy-related fatalities in 2012 were attributed to riding toys, including tricycles and nonmotorized scooters.</description>       <pubDate>Wed, 20 Nov 2013 10:00:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdStand By Your Pan\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Cook Safely This Thanksgiving to Prevent Kitchen Fires </title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/Stand-By-Your-Pan-Cook-Safely-This-Thanksgiving-to-Prevent-Kitchen-Fires-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/Stand-By-Your-Pan-Cook-Safely-This-Thanksgiving-to-Prevent-Kitchen-Fires-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</guid>       <description>The number of cooking fires more than triples on Thanksgiving Day.</description>       <pubDate>Thu, 14 Nov 2013 10:00:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>CPSC Urges Consumers to Replace Batteries in Smoke and CO Alarms When Turning Clocks Back </title>       <link>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/CPSC-Urges-Consumers-to-Replace-Batteries-in-Smoke-and-CO-Alarms-When-Turning-Clocks-Back-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</link>       <guid>http://www.cpsc.gov/zh-CN/Newsroom/News-Releases/2014/CPSC-Urges-Consumers-to-Replace-Batteries-in-Smoke-and-CO-Alarms-When-Turning-Clocks-Back-/?utm_source=rss&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=CPSC+News+RSS+Feed</guid>       <description>Daylight Saving Time ends on Sunday, November 3</description>       <pubDate>Thu, 31 Oct 2013 12:00:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>   </channel> </rss>
